bill_title: exempt the operators of certain older motorcycles from the special qualification required to operate a motorcycle.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to exempt the operators of certain older motorcycles from the special qualification required to operate a motorcycle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-20-2 be amended to read as follows: 32-20-2. No person may operate a motorcycle, except a moped as defined in § 32-20-1 , a motorcycle that was built before 1950 and that is not capable of traveling at a speed of more than thirty miles per hour, or a licensed all-terrain vehicle as provided by § 32-20-13, on the public streets or highways without a motor vehicle driver's license or permit upon which a state testing officer has certified that such the person is qualified to operate such the motorcycle. However, the operator of a moped , a motorcycle built before 1950 as provided by this section, or licensed all-terrain vehicle shall have a valid motor vehicle operator's license or permit. The department may waive the testing requirements upon completion of a motorcycle safety course approved pursuant to § 32-20-14. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.04 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
